  • Method Details

    • canGenerate

      public boolean canGenerate(ProceduralTerrain terrain, ETerrainOvergroundObject object, int variant, int objWidth, int objHeight, int objX, int objY)
      Checks all strategy conditions for the passed object type and variant, to determine if the object can be generated at the defined tile.
      Parameters:
      terrain - The ProceduralTerrain to compare against.
      object - The ETerrainOvergroundObject in question.
      variant - The integer variant of the ETerrainOvergroundObject in question.
      objWidth - The width of the overground object in tiles.
      This is represented as (BoundsEntity.getWidth() / CWorld.TILE_SIZE).
      objHeight - The height of the overground object in tiles.
      This is represented as (BoundsEntity.getHeight() / CWorld.TILE_SIZE).
      objX - The X-coordinate of the tile to generate the object. This considers an origin of (0, 0) as the center of the object.
      objY - The Y-coordinate of the tile to generate the object. This considers an origin of (0, 0) as the center of the object.
      Returns:
      True if the overground object can be generated, false otherwise.

    • getMaximumPerPlanetOfSameVariant

      int getMaximumPerPlanetOfSameVariant()
      Returns:
      The maximum number of overground objects of the same variant that can be placed on a planet. If the value is 0, no limit is applied.
      For example, with a return value of 3 for ETerrainOvergroundObject.Rocks: If the rock-27 overground object has already been generated three times, the generation of rock-2 will be prevented during all iterations of procedural generation that follow.

    • getMaximumPerPlanet

      int getMaximumPerPlanet()
      Returns:
      The maximum number of overground objects of the same type that can be placed on a planet. If the value is 0, no limit is applied.
      For example, with a return value of 3 for ETerrainOvergroundObject.Rocks: If any "Rocks" overground objects have already been generated a total of three times, the generation of any other "Rocks" overground object will be prevented during all iterations of procedural generation that follow.

    • getMinimumTileDistanceBetweenRepetitions

      int getMinimumTileDistanceBetweenRepetitions()
      Returns:
      The minimum distance between two overground objects of the same variant. If the value is 0, no limit is applied.
      For example, with a return value of 10 for ETerrainOvergroundObject.Rocks: If the rock-27 overground object has already been generated within 10 tiles of the currently iterated tile, the generation of rock-27 will be prevented. "Both directions" implies that the distance is calculated from the left and right edges of the object.

      range=((leftX - minWidth) && (rightX + minWidth)).

    • getMinimumTileDistanceBetweenRepetitionsOfType

      int getMinimumTileDistanceBetweenRepetitionsOfType()
      Returns:
      The minimum distance between two overground objects of the same type. If the value is 0, no limit is applied.
      For example, with a return value of 10 for ETerrainOvergroundObject.Rocks: If any "Rocks" overground objects have been generated within 10 tiles in both directions of the currently iterated tile, the generation of any "Rocks" is prevented. "Both directions" implies that the distance is calculated from the left and right edges of the object.

      range=((leftX - minWidth) && (rightX + minWidth)).

    • allowAdjacentRepitions

      boolean allowAdjacentRepitions()
      Returns:
      True if the overground object can be generated adjacent to another overground object of the same type. This does not consider variants.

    • allowAdjacentVariantRepitions

      boolean allowAdjacentVariantRepitions()
      Returns:
      True if the overground object can be generated adjacent to another overground object of the same variant.

    • getMinimumFreeSpaceAdjacent

      int getMinimumFreeSpaceAdjacent()
      Returns:
      the minimum number of tiles that must be free adjacent to the overground object for generation.
      - "Free" is defined as a tile that is not occupied by any other overground object, and is on the same Y-level as the currently iterated tile.
      - "Adjacent" is defined as the tiles directly to the left and right of the object, including the width of the object, where left is (objX - (objWidth / 2)) and right is (objX + (objWidth / 2)).
